Data: 10.15am This series has certainly been a role reversal from last year with England dominating both contests so far and Australia desperately needing some inspiration. The visitors have a heap of injury problems, the latest being Nathan Hauritz who has flown home and Sha
Australia 1 Shane Watson, 2 Tim Paine (wk), 3 Ricky Ponting (capt), 4 Michael Clarke, 5 Cameron White, 6 Mike Hussey, 7 James Hopes, 8 Steven Smith, 9 Ryan Harris, 10 Doug Bollinger, 11 Shaun Tait

England 1 Andrew Strauss (capt), 2 Craig Kieswetter (wk), 3 Kevin Pietersen, 4 Paul Collingwood, 5 Eoin Morgan, 6 Luke Wright, 7 Tim Bresnan, 8 Michael Yardy, 9 Graeme Swann, 10 Stuart Broad, 11 James Anderson

10.20am So, here we go. England have won the toss and put Australia into bat. The home side are unchanged after Michael Yardy pulled up okay from his minor leg injury. Australia have made two changes, with Tait straight into the line-up and Ryan Harris back from his gro
10.44am Right, people. It's time to get going. James Anderson has the ball, on his home ground, Watto's on strike ...
Anderson to Watson, no run good length delivery, not a lot of nip, but calmly pushed to mid-on
Anderson to Watson, no run hurried on middle-and-leg stump, a bit of climb off the seam. Defended easily enough
Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs that's a statement of intent. A fraction too short from Anderson, and no great venom in the delivery. Watson rocks back and clobbers that through midwicket
Anderson to Watson, no run that's a good riposte. Yorker, and well dug out
Anderson to Watson, no run zipping off the seam, clatters the thigh pad as Watson aims to flick through square leg
Anderson to Watson, no run better line and length, drawing a solid defensive block on off stump
Bresnan to Paine, no run good ball, on off stump, full length
Bresnan to Paine, 1 wide a bit of a nothing delivery, slipping down leg
Bresnan to Paine, no run outside off, full length again, angled into the gully
Bresnan to Paine, FOUR runs too full this time, an easy half-volley, and Paine punches coolly through long-off. Elegant
Bresnan to Paine, no run Bresnan responds by pulling his length back by half a yard. Blocked off the back foot
Bresnan to Paine, no run another lifter on off stump, angled into the gully
Bresnan to Paine, no run a touch of width, but no more than dabbed out to point. Another decent over
Anderson to Watson, no run outside off, no stroke offered this time
Anderson to Watson, no run that is a nut. Outside off, kicking off the turf, and just feinting past the edge. Good delivery
Anderson to Watson, 1 run dabbed down to third man, a decent line once again, but just enough width to open the face
Anderson to Paine, no run flicked off the hips to backward square
Anderson to Paine, 1 run the first out-and-out short ball of the game, and it's pulled without total control to deep square. Safe enough
Anderson to Watson, 1 run short, but without the same conviction, and Watson's pull is miscued to midwicket
Bresnan to Watson, no run outside off, through to the keeper
Bresnan to Watson, no run outside off again, and a loose nibble in response. Nearly an edge
Bresnan to Watson, no run a swished pull, but no contact. Loose again, and loud oohs as Kieswetter gathers
Bresnan to Watson, no run pushed back into the crease, and defended
Bresnan to Watson, no run right up in the blockhole, and lo and behold, it's blocked
Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs more kick off the turf, but that's misdirected, and helped calmly through backward square leg for another boundary
Anderson to Paine, no run drawn onto the front foot, blocked again
Anderson to Paine, no run tight line, good carry, left alone
Anderson to Paine, no run poked into the gully, sharp fielding and a threat of a shy keeps Paine in his crease
Anderson to Paine, no run bouncer, and a brisk one. No stroke offered on this occasion
Anderson to Paine, no run that's an ugly premeditated stroke. Gave himself room and aimed a wild swing through the covers. Anderson held his line and beat the edge
Anderson to Paine, no run off-stump lifter. Defended to bring to an end a tidy over
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run open-faced glide down to third man. Effective use of the width
Bresnan to Paine, 1 wide banged in short, too short.
Bresnan to Paine, no run forced back into the crease by a tight delivery, back of a length
Bresnan to Paine, no run Paine goes right back in his crease, and Bresnan follows him with a yorker. Good canny bowling
Bresnan to Paine, no run dabbed into the covers, and another dot ball piles up to keep Paine under the cosh
Bresnan to Paine, FOUR runs that's a good release of pressure. Not a bad delivery, but played firmly on the up, and through the covers
Bresnan to Paine, 1 run that's wild, and ugly. A smear over the covers, and he just clears Anderson running back. Bresnan is not impressed, and informs the batsman as such
Anderson to Paine, no run blocked. Tight bowling from Anderson, no width at all
Anderson to Paine, no run big inside-edge as Anderson nips one off the seam from a good length. Half an appeal
Anderson to Paine, 1 run flashed down to third man, just a single
Anderson to Watson, 1 run third man is in business again as Watson flashes another single through the cordon
Anderson to Paine, 1 run another single to third man. Just a touch too wide from Anderson, but Australia can't capitalise
Anderson to Watson, no run a good finish to the over, a big offcutter, and it nearly worms its way through Watson's defences. Nearly, but not quite.
Bresnan to Paine, FOUR runs that's a better stroke, as Bresnan serves up another rare half-volley. Good stride, full face, and there's no catching that
Bresnan to Paine, 2 runs back of a length, swished through point
Bresnan to Paine, FOUR runs that's a pie from Bresnan, short and wide, and Paine slams it gleefully through point. A costly over so far
Bresnan to Paine, no run better this time, tighter line, and respectfully defended
Bresnan to Paine, FOUR runs down the track, lofted drive, good contact, and mid-on can't get close to that. A third four in five balls
Bresnan to Paine, FOUR runs short, and swung away over fine leg. A hint of a top-edge, but they all count. An expensive over, but Paine is up and running, so too are Australia
Anderson to Watson, no run tight from Anderson, defended into the gully
Anderson to Watson, no run punched drive, tidied up by mid-on
Anderson to Watson, no run driven back to the bowler, full and straight from Anderson
Anderson to Watson, no run a hint of width, but carved only as far as point
Anderson to Watson, 1 run targeting the base of middle stump, but whipped wristily to midwicket for a quick single
Anderson to Paine, no run outside off, a hint of wobble through the air, defended to point. Another fine over from Anderson, who's been the pick of the attack this morning
Broad to Watson, no run full and straight, punched back down the pitch
Broad to Watson, 1 run chipped to mid-on, and a scampered single as the shy comes in. Home safe
Broad to Paine, FOUR runs short and leg-sided, it would have been wide if it had been left alone, but instead it was helped on its way by Paine, who is now flying
Broad to Paine, FOUR runs down the leg-side again, another four, much finer this time. Poor work from Broad
Broad to Paine, no run open-faced steer to point.
Broad to Paine, no run a firm-footed plant, and chipped into the leg-side
Anderson to Watson, 1 run tucked off the toes to midwicket
Anderson to Paine, no run big stride, and solid defence, into the covers
Anderson to Paine, no run bouncer, no stroke offered
Anderson to Paine, no run solid stride, and pushed into the covers
Anderson to Paine, no run turned off the toes, but without any power
Anderson to Paine, no run impeccable over, tight line and length, no liberties on offer
Wright to Watson, 1 run good start, full and straight, and defended
Wright to Paine, 1 run an ambitious swipe through the line, no timing in the shot, but enough bat to steal a single to mid-on
Wright to Watson, 2 runs a desperate gallop as Swann's shy comes in from fine leg. But he's safely home
Wright to Watson, no run full stride, and pushed up to cover
Wright to Watson, SIX runs slower ball, and that was picked straight from the hand. Watson drops to one knee and mows it over midwicket. Top tonking
Wright to Watson, FOUR runs strays onto the pads, and a tidy over is suddenly transformed into an expensive one. Fourteen off the over as that shot fizzes through the gap at wide mid-on
Broad to Paine, no run that one went like an offbreak, and nearly nipped out the off stump. Good delivery
Broad to Paine, FOUR runs too short, and that's spanked on the up through backward point. Australia are cooking now, and England need to think on their feet, as they did to good effect at Cardiff
Broad to Paine, no run fuller length, and defended to cover. That's a better length for this wicket
Broad to Paine, 1 wide poor bowling, speared down the leg-side
Broad to Paine, no run better line and length once again
Broad to Paine, 1 run tucked off the toes to square leg
Broad to Watson, no run inside-edged defence to bring an end to a mixed over
Yardy to Paine, no run looped onto a good length to launch his spell
Yardy to Paine, no run clipped coolly to midwicket

Yardy to Paine, OUT that is absolutely plumb! Paine steps back for a flick through midwicket, but is beaten by the angle from wide of the crease and nailed right in front of middle. That's the breakthrough, and not before time from England's point of view
Yardy to Ponting, no run wide of the crease again, and played watchfully
Yardy to Ponting, no run Collingwood comes in at silly point as Ponting drives
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run off the mark with a punch into the covers
Broad to Ponting, no run right up in the blockhole, defended to mid-on
Broad to Ponting, no run width and lift, Ponting cracks one off the back foot, but it's swiftly fielded at point
Broad to Ponting, no run this one nips back off the seam a fraction. Cautiously defended into the covers
Broad to Ponting, no run drilled into the covers, but can't pierce the field
Broad to Ponting, no run shorter, and Ponting attempts his signature pull, but he can't time that one
Broad to Ponting, no run full and straight, that's a tidy maiden of the Wag variety, or should I say, Fuf?
Yardy to Watson, no run outside off, chopped down to short third man
Yardy to Watson, no run very full from round the wicket, dug out down to mid on
Yardy to Watson, no run ooh, another appeal for lbw but this one is strangled as it's going down leg on the angle
Yardy to Watson, no run comes forward and defends
Yardy to Watson, 1 run worked off leg stump stump past midwicket as he finally beats the field
Yardy to Ponting, no run outside off, leans forward in defence and pushed into the covers
Swann to Watson, 2 runs nicely done, waited for it and opened the face through short third man who makes a good chase and keeps them to two
Swann to Watson, FOUR runs same shot and more reward this time, a little too wide from Swann and it gives Watson the room to tab it fine through third man
Swann to Watson, 1 run straighter and Watson goes back to whip this through midwicket
Swann to Ponting, no run nicely bowled on off stump, Ponting comes forward and pushes to the leg side
Swann to Ponting, 1 run goes back and pushes through the covers
Swann to Watson, no run can't beat square leg this time as he turns this from the stumps...Swann just taking a little while to settle
Yardy to Ponting, no run pushed firmly into the covers
Yardy to Ponting, no run leans forward, opens the face a touch into the off side
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run dragged down very short and helped through the leg side out to deep square
Yardy to Watson, no run another short one, but it hurries onto Watson who has to be quick to pull it to midwicket
Yardy to Watson, no run defended out to midwicket
Yardy to Watson, SIX runs that goes all the way, too short and Watson had all the time in the world to wait on the back foot and pull it over deep midwicket...a good way for Australia to go to drinks
Swann to Ponting, no run worked from outside off into the leg side

Swann to Ponting, 1 wide, OUT gone! Huge wicket for England and great work from Kieswetter as this one spins sharply down the leg side, beating Ponting as he comes down the pitch and the wicketkeeper brings the ball back from very wide with the Aussie captain str
Swann to Clarke, no run comes forward on off stump and defends
Swann to Clarke, 3 runs too short outside off, Clarke uses the crease well and steps back to cut through point
Swann to Watson, no run worked out to midwicket
Swann to Watson, no run whipped from outside into the leg side but can't find the gap
Swann to Watson, 1 run short and pulled away through the leg side but picks out the man at deep midwicket
Yardy to Watson, no run goes back and punches into the off side
Yardy to Watson, 1 run wide outside off but it only costs a single as he cuts out to deep cover
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run too short again, gives Clarke plenty of time to force it through the covers
Yardy to Watson, no run ooh, almost another but this drops just in front of short third man as Watson cuts without the placement he wanted
Yardy to Watson, 1 run driven down the ground to long-off to bring the 100
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run waiting on the back foot, cut through point out to the sweeper
Broad to Clarke, 1 run ooh, well bowled, went for a double bluff and pitched it up...Clarke's footwork not there and he gets a thick inside edge out to deep square
Broad to Watson, FOUR runs handsome...floated up outside off stump, a slower ball and it's driven dismissively through cover. He loves that shot.
Broad to Watson, 1 run punched down the ground to long-on and there's another fifty for Watson, this time from 54 balls. Now, can he convert one?
Broad to Clarke, 1 wide there we go, the expected bouncer, but it's too short and going down the leg side
Broad to Clarke, no run back of a length, Clarke hops back and defends into the off side
Broad to Clarke, no run he's not too comfortable with that one, goes for a pull and it takes his arm then into the body
Broad to Clarke, no run well bowled, but Clarke is easily behind it on his tip-toes and defends by his feet
Yardy to Watson, 1 wide fired way down the leg side
Yardy to Watson, no run chopped fine to short third man
Yardy to Watson, no run very quick outside off, cut away and a good piece of fielding from Strauss prevents any runs
Yardy to Watson, no run defended down by off stump
Yardy to Watson, 1 run floated in on middle, punched with a straight bat down the ground
Yardy to Clarke, 2 runs works this off the stumps and he's placed it well between deep square and midwicket so it allows two
Yardy to Clarke, no run very full, dug out and fielded by the bowler in his follow through
Broad to Watson, 1 run that squares up Watson and takes the outside edge down to third man as he tries to play through the leg side
Broad to Clarke, 1 run short ball and pulled away with a mixture of a hook and a pull to find deep square
Broad to Watson, no run back in his crease, dropped into the off side and backward point is quickly in
Broad to Watson, no run good line from Broad, on off stump and Watson is all defence back to the bowler
Broad to Watson, 1 run nice drive, beats Broad as he dives across but mid-off is up and keeps them to a single
Broad to Clarke, no run back of a length, forced into the off side

Yardy to Watson, no run good fielding back the non-striker's stumps...that was drilled straight by Watson and crashed into the timbers. Saved four, and also saved umpire Ian Gould from having to get out of the firing line
Yardy to Watson, no run onto the front foot and defends
Yardy to Watson, no run quicker ball and does Watson who has to jab down to avoid being bowled
Yardy to Watson, no run misses out on a pull and is taken on the body
Yardy to Watson, 1 run latches onto the pull this time, but hits it quite straight and one bounce to long-on
Yardy to Clarke, no run pushed gently into the leg side
Swann to Watson, 1 run whipped along the ground through midwicket and the deep man is quick to keep them to one
Swann to Clarke, 1 run uses his feet, almost yorks himself and just digs it out down to long-on
Swann to Watson, 1 run full outside off, heaved through the leg side but doesn't find the gap and picks out deep midwicket
Swann to Clarke, no run down the pitch, Swann responds by dragging the length back and Clarke defends to the covers
Swann to Clarke, no run more turn for Swann, beats Clarke's defensive push and into the pads
Swann to Clarke, 1 run flicked in the air through midwicket but just wide of the fielder inside the circle
Yardy to Clarke, 2 runs angled down the leg side, tucked through short fine-leg and they scamper back
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run steps back and cuts through the off side...Clarke is very good and using the crease against spinners
Yardy to Watson, 1 run on off stump, driven down the ground
Yardy to Clarke, no run on middle and off, defended down the pitch
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run short and punched down the on side, beats Yardy's dive
Yardy to Watson, 1 run full on leg stump, worked out to deep midwicket
Swann to Watson, no run turned from off stump to square leg
Swann to Watson, 1 run flicked down to long-on
Swann to Clarke, 1 run uses his feet, worked away through midwicket
Swann to Watson, no run nicely tossed up on off stump, Watson comes forward and defends to cover
Swann to Watson, 2 runs quicker this time and too straight, flicked out to deep square and he hurries back for a second

Swann to Watson, OUT gone! Swann makes another breakthrough and Watson again can't convert...he tries to turn this into the leg side, it all looks quite innocuous, but some extra bounce meant he just lobs a simple catch to square leg
Yardy to Clarke, no run down the pitch and defended to midwicket
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run worked down to long-on with a whirl of the bat
Yardy to White, no run outside off, defended square on the off side
Yardy to White, no run full on middle, defended back to the bowler

Yardy to White, FOUR runs nicely onto the back foot, driven through the off side and the timing is so good that he beats three fielders into the boundary...that was very elegant from a batsman known for brute force
Yardy to White, no run fired in quicker, defended to silly point
Swann to Clarke, 1 run down the pitch, worked from outside off to long-on
Swann to White, no run outside off, comes forward and defends
Swann to White, no run pushed back to the bowler
Swann to White, 1 run swept firmly from off stump out to deep square-leg
Swann to Clarke, no run back into his crease and turned straight to square leg where Watson was caught
Swann to Clarke, no run beaten this time as he tries to glide to third man
Bresnan to White, FOUR runs and he starts with a short wide ball which is spanked through the off side...not a great start for Bresnan
Bresnan to White, no run so close! Bresnan finds the outside edge this time but the ball doesn't quite carry to Kieswetter, much better line and White was trying to fiddle it to third man
Bresnan to White, no run tucked out to midwicket
Bresnan to White, no run driven hard off the back foot but straight back to Bresnan who fields well
Bresnan to White, no run tries to work into the off side but just ends up popping it back towards the bowler
Bresnan to White, no run beaten this time as he tries to drive off the back foot so a good comeback from Bresnan after that early boundary
Swann to Clarke, no run tossed up high, and clipped straight to midwicket
Swann to Clarke, 1 run sharp turn, but can't find the gap as it's helped round the corner
Swann to White, no run fully forward and watchfully blocked
Swann to White, 1 run a nudged single into the leg-side
Swann to Clarke, no run solidly forward
Swann to Clarke, 1 run rocks back, and plays against the spin to backward point. Tidy bowling
Bresnan to Clarke, no run back of a length, and that's flat-batted into the covers, and just short of mid-off. Ugly stroke
Bresnan to Clarke, 2 runs flighty stuff from Clarke. Another swish, and a spiralling top-edge lands safe at backward square
Bresnan to Clarke, 2 runs more confident this time, a firm pull to deep midwicket
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run stroked out to extra cover.
Bresnan to White, no run tucked up on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
Bresnan to White, no run full and straight, poked to cover.
Swann to Clarke, 1 run up on the toes, rocks back, and cut firmly to deep point
Swann to White, 1 run swept fine, down on one knee and effectively played
Swann to Clarke, no run drawn forward, and pushed to mid-on
Swann to Clarke, 1 run quick footwork, and another thumped cut
Swann to White, no run big stride forward, blocked with a full face
Swann to White, no run sharp delivery to finish - flatter, faster and tweaking significantly. Defended
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run fearsome start! Well, not really, but it's a good stump-to-stump delivery, and Clarke all but chops on
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run tidy line and length, no liberties on offer as yet
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run solidly forward, head over the ball, and defended
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run looped up, driven calmly to mid-on
PD Collingwood to White, no run punched back up the pitch, it ends up clipping the non-striker's stumps, but no danger
PD Collingwood to White, 1 run that's a very tidy start, defended back down the pitch
Swann to White, OUT swept, and snaffled at square leg! A full-blooded stroke, but Strauss scoops the ball low to his left, and that's a key wicket!
Swann to Hussey, no run round the wicket, and Hussey is in all sorts of trouble, playing for the spin but nearly chopping the straight one onto his timbers
Swann to Hussey, no run another squeakingly close delivery, outside off, and snaking past the stump as Kieswetter whips off the bails for good measure
Swann to Hussey, no run this one turns, straightening on middle stump. Wily work
Swann to Hussey, no run poked uneasily to slip, all along the ground
Swann to Hussey, no run a wicket maiden, and that's magnificent. Deflected to gully
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run outside off, and slapped to backward point
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run round the wicket, floated up, and driven to cover
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run tidy again from Collingwood, driven straight back into his midriff
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run clipped off the toes, picked up at midwicket
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run tossed up, right into the blockhole, driven to cover
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run flicked from outside off to short midwicket. That's a fine over, and it's also time for drinks
Swann to Hussey, no run speared down the leg-side, raps the pad
Swann to Hussey, no run pushed right back into the crease, sharp pace
Swann to Hussey, FOUR runs that's a cracking stroke, a murderous mown slog-sweep, reminiscent of his blows in that epic T20 semi-final
Swann to Hussey, 1 run forward and blocked to cover
Swann to Clarke, no run forward and defended, back to the bowler
Swann to Clarke, no run good finish to the over. England have got a bit of a stranglehold at present, but as Hussey briefly demonstrated, the shackles can yet be broken
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run round the wicket, and that was worth an appeal as it was definitely pad first. Just outside the line though
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run outside off, punched into the covers
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run tossed up, Clarke mets it on the half-volley with some urgent footwork, and clipped to wide mid-on
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run speared into the blockhole, squeezed out to point for another quick single
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run a hint of width, and panned out to point. Australia are content to trade in ones for the moment
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run pre-meditated sweep, but he makes a hash of that. Loud appeal for lbw, but that struck him outside the line again. Still, uncomfortable times for the batsmen
Swann to Clarke, 1 run finds the gap for another single
Swann to Hussey, 1 run chopped out to deep point
Swann to Clarke, no run tossed up, and clipped to midwicket. No liberties on offer at the moment
Swann to Clarke, OUT oh dear, that was out from the moment he went through with the stroke. Done in the flight, and Clarke's uppish drive picks out the sub, Ian Bell, at long-off.
Swann to Hussey, 1 run forward, and defended into the gap at cover for a single
Swann to Smith, no run tossed up outside off, mistimed drive, and no run there. A superb spell comes to an end
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run cramped for room on off stump, defended to gully
Yardy to Smith, 1 run round the wicket, and looped into the blockhole. Defended to cover
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run deflected backward of point for another single
Yardy to Smith, 1 run
Yardy to Hussey, FOUR runs that's a very tidy stroke, reverse sweep, and picks the gap expertly. Valuable runs
Yardy to Hussey, FOUR runs valiant work from Pietersen on the deep point boundary, but his foot is touching the rope.
PD Collingwood to Smith, 1 run worked off middle into the leg side
PD Collingwood to Hussey, OUT gone and another one departs...Collingwood strikes with an off cutter that scoots through on off stump and beats Hussey's push. That had been coming.
PD Collingwood to Hopes, 1 run opens his account straight away as he punches down to long-on
PD Collingwood to Smith, 2 runs worked off the stumps down towards fine leg
PD Collingwood to Smith, no run very full and flicked straight to square leg
PD Collingwood to Smith, no run again turned to square leg to end a successful over
Yardy to Hopes, no run worked into the leg side
Yardy to Hopes, 1 run driven straight down to long-on
Yardy to Smith, 1 run tucked off leg stump wide of short fine-leg
Yardy to Hopes, 1 run another one tucked into the leg side, this time out to deep square
Yardy to Smith, 1 run touch too straight and helped into the big leg-side spaces again
Yardy to Hopes, no run excellent work in his follow through as Yardy dives full stretch to stop a well-timed drive
PD Collingwood to Smith, FOUR runs there's some aggression as this is heaved from off stump through the leg side and both midwicket and mid-on are inside the circle
PD Collingwood to Smith, 1 run dropped into the off side and well run
PD Collingwood to Hopes, 1 run no timing from Hopes as he tries to force off the back foot and it dribbles to long-on
PD Collingwood to Smith, no run more 'turn' for Collingwood as this beats Smith's flick and takes the pad into the off side
PD Collingwood to Smith, 1 run nice lap wide of short fine-leg
PD Collingwood to Hopes, no run can't beat midwicket where captain Strauss makes a one-handed save
Anderson to Smith, 1 run starts with a full toss on leg stump but Smith can only force it through the leg side for a single
Anderson to Hopes, 2 runs back of a length, worked through deep midwicket and good running makes it into a couple...Australia's 200 is up
Anderson to Hopes, no run excellent yorker, not much Hopes can do except dig it out
Anderson to Hopes, 1 run another good yorker, this time he manages to work it down to long-on
Anderson to Smith, 1 run stays full and pushed down the pitch, but Anderson fumbles the stop in his follow through and is very annoyed as it gives away a single

Anderson to Hopes, OUT gone! Anderson strikes with a slower ball which was back of a length and makes Hopes play the pull far too early, resulting in an under edge onto off stump...now it's down to the bowlers
Broad to Smith, 2 runs short and pulled away through midwicket
Broad to Smith, 1 run goes for the yorker, comes out a low full toss which is worked out to deep square
Broad to Harris, 1 run back of a length, pulled out to deep square who is quickly in from the boundary
Broad to Smith, 1 run connects well with this pull but it goes straight to deep midwicket
Broad to Harris, OUT and that's why it's all short, because it works, as Harris splices an attempted pull and lobs a simple catch Strauss at midwicket who has been in the action today
Broad to Bollinger, no run short on leg stump, takes Bollinger on the back side as he doesn't play a shot
Anderson to Smith, 1 run low full toss which is drilled down to long-on...England won't mind that
Anderson to Bollinger, 3 runs he goes over the covers and clears the in field, Luke Wright chases hard and a better throw could have had Bollinger in trouble as he came back for three
Anderson to Smith, no run brilliant yorker, Smith tried to give himself room but was followed by Anderson
Anderson to Smith, OUT another goes! Anderson gets his second as Smith goes for a sweep and is taken on the heel of his back foot which looked in line with leg stump
Anderson to Tait, 1 run good yorker, dug out towards the keeper and they scamper a single
Anderson to Bollinger, OUT all over! Dead-eye yorker from Anderson as Bollinger backs away to try and go through the off side and the ball strikes bottom of middle. That is that.

Brilliant stuff from England who fought back superbly after Watson and Paine added 75. The spinners, led by Swann, were outstanding backed up by Michael Yardy while James Anderson did the late damage. Australia are a side low on confidence and will need a huge effort to

Ricky Ponting, who's close to suffering a rather terminal sense-of-humour failure on this trip, has just given his team a bit of a rollicking in their huddle. Here come England's openers, Andrew Strauss and Craig Kieswetter ... and it will be Shaun Tait to bowl the firs

Meanwhile, how's this for a premonition of traumas to come. Germany victorious as England are undermined by penalties. And the Aussies, well they crashed out long ago. Yes, I'm talking about the European Grand Prix, which is live on ESPNF1 right now ...

Welcome back. Andrew Miller here for the start of England's run-chase. They need 213 and ... well, it should be a regulation victory given how well they've played of late. But you know what they say about assumptions.
Tait to Strauss, no run rapid first delivery, outside off, and no stroke offered. Tidy and threatening start
Tait to Strauss, no run fizzed down once again, late swing after the ball passes the bat. No stroke
Tait to Strauss, 1 run width, and toe-ended down to third man to get Strauss off the mark
Tait to Pietersen, no run another yorker-length delivery, but outside off this time. Prodded away uncertainly. 96.7mph, apparently!
Tait to Pietersen, no run full length, and driven, but without any timing. What a start
Bollinger to Strauss, no run a strangled appeal as Strauss shapes to flick down leg. Going down
Bollinger to Strauss, no run attempted pull, but no real contact
Bollinger to Strauss, no run Strauss swings into another pull, but the ball is long gone by the time he completes his shot

Bollinger to Strauss, 3 runs driven firmly into the covers, Ponting takes the pace off with his fingertips, before Steven Smith hauls it back in with an insanely committed head-first dive. Lucky there wasn't a speaker in the way of that effort
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run a juicy half-volley, but KP rifles that straight to cover
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run outside off, and left calmly alone
Tait to Strauss, 1 run good batting from Strauss, put bat to ball and stole an instant single to keep the strike rotating
Tait to Pietersen, no run slower ball, and Pietersen punches that back to the bowler
Tait to Pietersen, no run right into the blockhole again, but forewarned is forearmed for Pietersen. He was ready for that delivery, and dug it out with ease
Tait to Pietersen, 1 run flicked off the toes, well timed, but Ponting at midwicket defies his ageing limbs to field with a tumble
Tait to Strauss, 1 wide too much width on that one
Tait to Strauss, no run pushed back into the crease, and defended to midwicket
Tait to Strauss, no run bouncer, and Strauss ducks. Good aggression
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run defended with a dead bat, and the ball plops down at Pietersen's feet
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run outside off, KP thinks about having a dart, but thinks better of it. As well he might. Plenty time in this innings
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run strikes the pads on leg stump, and balloons into the covers
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run good wheels from Bollinger, still no stroke
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run left alone once again
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run a solid over, tight line and no rushing from Pietersen
Harris to Strauss, no run nice start, bursting past the edge with good carry. Nearly the breakthrough
Harris to Strauss, FOUR runs fetch that. Over-pitched, and pumped through the covers. Well waited, that's the first boundary of the innings
Harris to Strauss, no run full again, but short extra intercepts another firm drive
Harris to Strauss, no run outside off, shaping away from the left-hander, no stroke offered
Harris to Strauss, no run right up to the bat, dug out to mid-off
Harris to Strauss, 1 run on the hips, nudged square
Bollinger to Strauss, no run outside off, and bending back into the left-hander
Bollinger to Strauss, no run firmly blocked out to cover
Bollinger to Strauss, no run short, and Strauss sways out of the way

Bollinger to Strauss, no run banged in short, takes the glove and deflects down to the slips. England's slow men made the difference in Australia's innings, but the Aussie quicks are bowling well so far
Bollinger to Strauss, no run full length, attacking the stumps, and defended again. Solid work
Bollinger to Strauss, no run
Harris to Pietersen, 1 run swinging down the leg-side, strikes the pad
Harris to Strauss, FOUR runs lovely strike, just a touch of width and rifled through point. No stopping that
Harris to Strauss, no run punched into the off side
Harris to Strauss, no run
Harris to Strauss, 1 run
Harris to Pietersen, FOUR runs cracking strike, beautifully timed on-drive, he saw that alright!
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run worked off leg stump out to deep square
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run angling across Pietersen and left alone
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run ooh, Pietersen walks across the crease and misses his whip as the ball passes over middle and leg
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run left alone outside off
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run a touch of width, angled out to point
Bollinger to Strauss, no run angled delivery, strikes the pad but always going over. Strauss thinks about a single but is rightly sent back

Harris to Pietersen, FOUR runs banged in short, and with fine leg up, Pietersen was never going to miss out on that. Even with fine leg back he'd have climbed into it! And Harris is annoyed with himself
Harris to Pietersen, FOUR runs overpitched to compensate, and Pietersen is onto that in a flash, a sweetly struck on-drive. Two in two

Harris to Pietersen, no run nippy delivery, and Pietersen is nipped in the bud! That's gotta hurt ... and sure enough it does ... he's down and taking a breather. The physio is out, but as David Lloyd points out, what exactly can he do? Give him a rub?
Harris to Pietersen, no run pushed back into the crease, and defended into the covers
Harris to Pietersen, no run
Harris to Pietersen, FOUR runs that's too good, steps out and across, and helps the ball round the corner. A costly over, and England's chase is up and running now
Bollinger to Strauss, no run short, and through to the keeper
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run tucked into the gap, another run to the cause
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run that one kicks a touch, and Pietersen is surprised as he plays it down off the glove
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run half a stride forward, and defended into the covers
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run outside off once again, a very measured run-chase so far
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run rising delivery on off stump, no stroke offered there
Hopes to Strauss, no run driven, off a slight inside-edge, to midwicket
Hopes to Strauss, FOUR runs ungainly, but effective. Hopes drops short, so Strauss cross-bats him straight back over his head. Undefended, and four
Hopes to Strauss, 1 run attempted steer out to backward point
Hopes to Pietersen, 1 run outside off, dabbed down to third man
Hopes to Strauss, 1 run width outside off once again, nurdled away
Hopes to Pietersen, FOUR runs driven on the up, not entirely convincing, but it lobs over the infield and rolls away for another boundary
Clarke to Strauss, no run big shout, and that looked exceptionally close! Massive appeal, but a touch outside the line?
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run tucked out to square leg
Clarke to Pietersen, no run replays suggest Strauss was more than a bit lucky with that lbw appeal
Clarke to Pietersen, 1 run picks the gap with a calm drive
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run Strauss returns the compliment
Clarke to Pietersen, no run big stride forward, and defended
Tait to Strauss, no run bouncer, and a quick one. Strauss ducks
Tait to Strauss, no run outside off, zippy pace, fizzes past the edge
Tait to Strauss, 1 run short and quick, and Strauss is unsettled as he sways back to pull. Gets enough bat on it in the end. Pretty close to treading on his stumps though!
Tait to Pietersen, no run clipped up to mid-on
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 wide down the leg-side
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 run fine delivery, late-swinging yorker, shovelled out to midwicket
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run big stride and smothered on the line of off stump
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run forward once again and defended
Clarke to PD Collingwood, SIX runs down the track, full swing of the blade, straight into the crowd at long-on. Shot
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run flicked out to midwicket
Clarke to Strauss, 2 runs on the pads, flicked fine, Harris chases and intercepts with a slide
Clarke to Strauss, FOUR runs too much width outside off stump, and that's battered past point, as Strauss waited and waited, then belted it
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run pushed back onto the stumps, and defended again
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 wide misdirected, down the leg-side
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run punched drive, out to mid-off
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run crunched out to cover, from a full length
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run banged in short, and Collingwood ducks
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 wide down the leg-side again. The radar's gone a touch here
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run full and straight. Defended with a vertical blade
Tait to PD Collingwood, no run flinched out to point from back in the crease
Hopes to Strauss, no run round the wicket, defended into the covers
Hopes to Strauss, 1 run down the leg side, clipped away through backward square
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run back of a length, defended towards mid-on
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run goes for a drive, gets an inside edge and it rolls dangerously into his boot and almost towards the stumps
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run worked away out to deep square
Hopes to Strauss, 1 run opens the face and glides it down to third man...all England need to do is tick the score over
Harris to Strauss, no run tries to work this to the leg side and misses
Harris to Strauss, 1 run width outside off and Strauss runs it down to wide third man
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run back of a length, pushed out to midwicket
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run fuller outside and driven to cover
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run turned into the leg side, can't beat Ponting at midwicket
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run keeps the strike with a guide to third man
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 2 runs wide outside off, allows Collingwood to free his arms as he drives through cover and the sweeper does the fielding...turn into a bit of a flat-bat drive
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run inside edge into the pads as Hopes tries to replicate Collingwood's success with medium-pace cutters
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run pushed off the back foot to mid-off
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run sweetly timed drive down to long-on
Hopes to Strauss, no run round the wicket, tucked out to midwicket
Hopes to Strauss, 1 run outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
Harris to Strauss, 1 run worked from off stump with the angle from round the wicket out to deep square
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run defended off the back foot to cover
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run fuller on off stump, punched back to Harris
Harris to PD Collingwood, 2 runs that's easy for Collingwood, half volley on leg stump is clipped neatly between deep square and fine leg
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run leg stump line again, tucked away with Collingwood's trademark nudge to fine leg
Harris to Strauss, no run on off stump, defended to point
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run on off stump, comes forward and defends
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run tossed up nicely on middle with a hint of drift, pushed into the covers
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run goes back and drives off the back foot to long-off
Smith to Strauss, no run goes for a sweep from outside off and gets a bottom edge that rolls backwards past the stumps
Smith to Strauss, 1 run worked in the air wide of the bowler and down to long-on
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run quicker ball on leg stump, worked out to deep midwicket
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run outside off and driven hard to short cover
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run driven up to mid-off
Hopes to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs on middle stump and flicked in the air over midwicket and it beats long-on into the boundary...well timed by Collingwood
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run sensible batting as he now opens the face and gets a single third man to rotate the strike
Hopes to Strauss, no run beaten outside off as he tries to steer to third man again
Hopes to Strauss, 2 runs full on the stumps, Strauss uses the angle well and places it through midwicket
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run tucked off leg stump out to deep midwicket
Smith to Strauss, no run pushed across outside off, Strauss leans forward and pushes to cover
Smith to Strauss, FOUR runs touch short and allows Strauss to go back and cut, it probably goes finer than he wanted but comfortably beats short third-man
Smith to Strauss, 1 run worked away into the off side
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run pushed easily down to long-off
Smith to Strauss, no run played into the covers and Strauss goes for a wander before deciding against the single which is a wise move
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run round the wicket, driven down the ground and brings up England's 100
Clarke to Strauss, no run over the wicket, on off stump and defended to the leg side
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run drilled down the on side past Clarke to long-on
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run easily pushed down to long-off to bring up the fifty stand between captain and vice-captain...very steady stuff
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run worked off the back foot square through the leg side
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run comes forward and defends on middle and off
Smith to Strauss, no run defended off the back foot, playing with the hint of turn to the on side
Smith to Strauss, 1 run drives into the covers with an open face and it's a quick single
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run driven down the on side, bowler and non-striker get into a tangle but midwicket does the fielding
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run uses his wrists to work into a gap at midwicket from a leg-stump line
Smith to Strauss, no run round the wicket, Strauss misses his flick and there's an appeal for lbw but it's well outside off
Smith to Strauss, no run goes for a sweep from well wide of off stump and doesn't make contact
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run out comes the reverse sweep but he picks out short third-man
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run uses his feet and bunts it through straight midwicket
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run well played, a full ball and he opens the face to find a gap at cover...clever batting
Clarke to Strauss, 1 run this time Strauss pushes into the gap at cover and that takes him to his second consecutive fifty, this one from 68 balls
Clarke to PD Collingwood, no run pushed into the leg side
Clarke to PD Collingwood, 1 run uses his feet then flicks it off his toes out to deep square-leg
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run oh, well bowled...this is quicker and skids at Collingwood who is caught on the back foot
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run comes forward and defends
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run worked into the leg side
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run beats short midwicket with a drive down the ground
Smith to Strauss, no run a little short, worked around the corner to short fine-leg
Smith to Strauss, 1 run opens the face and pushes square on the off side
Tait to Strauss, 1 run nicely pulled away off one leg out to deep square
Tait to PD Collingwood, 1 run a surprise bouncer, Collingwood goes for the pull and doesn't really connect which might actually save him as the ball falls short of deep square-leg
Tait to Strauss, no run full outside off and pushed to cover
Tait to Strauss, FOUR runs down the leg side and all that need was a touch as Strauss flicks it down to fine leg
Tait to Strauss, no run wide outside off and Strauss misses a flamboyant drive
Tait to Strauss, no run more width but Strauss doesn't time his cut and it bounces to Clarke at backward point
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run full on off stump, nicely driven through the covers to the sweeper
Smith to Strauss, 1 run round the wicket, whipped down to long on
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run onto the back foot and work away through square leg
Smith to Strauss, 1 run onto the front foot and again finds the gap easily to the sweeper
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run the bowler fields in his follow through from a straight drive
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run pushed into the off side to end a tidy over but Australia need more than tidy overs
Tait to Strauss, 1 wide big appeal as this is speared down the leg side, but Aleem Dar has none of it and calls wide. Strauss's bat was nowhere near it
Tait to Strauss, no run on middle and worked out to midwicket
Tait to Strauss, no run boy, that was a quick bouncer and Strauss bails out of any thoughts of a hook shot...Paine had to leap to take it
Tait to Strauss, no run slower ball very full outside off, pitches in the footholes and Strauss leaves alone
Tait to Strauss, no run angled out to backward point and can't beat Michael Clarke
Tait to Strauss, no run fuller outside off, defended with soft hands and it bounces backwards towards the stumps
Tait to Strauss, no run back of a length, defended back to the bowler
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run onto the back foot and punched to a very straight and short midwicket
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run on middle and defended to the off side
Smith to PD Collingwood, 2 runs down the pitch and clubbed away through midwicket to cries of 'catch it' but it's clear of everyone as deep midwicket collects
Smith to PD Collingwood, 2 runs drifts outside leg stump and it's nicely paddled way by Collingwood through short fine-leg
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run misses out this time as he tries to work into the leg side
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run tossed up on leg stump, pushed firmly out to deep midwicket

Bollinger to PD Collingwood, OUT Gone! The change works immediately as Collingwood pushes with no great certainty outside off and chops the ball onto his stumps. It was on a length, wobbling around just outside off and he just pushed his bat at it without convict
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run full and nudged to midwicket, and Morgan is off the mark straight away
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run flashed square on the up, but the cover sweeper runs round and hurls the ball back quickly
Bollinger to Morgan, no run back of a length, outside off and Morgan leaves well alone. That appeared to seam away a touch as well
Bollinger to Morgan, no run much fuller this time, Morgan leans forward and tucks to midwicket, but straight to the fielder and hit too well to risk a quick single
Bollinger to Morgan, no run driven hard on the off side this time, but again he picks out the fielder - at cover
Harris to Strauss, no run very full to start, dug out to midwicket
Harris to Strauss, 2 runs Harris pulls the length back but pushes this one wide of off and Strauss carves out to deep cover
Harris to Strauss, 1 run punched through the covers off the back foot, and they amble through for one
Harris to Morgan, no run driven to mid off, but that hit the bottom of the bat and was trickling along when it reached the fielder
Harris to Morgan, 1 run full again, wider this time and Morgan drives out to the cover sweeper
Harris to Strauss, no run very full to finish, Strauss jams the bat down to keep the yorker out
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run rising fairly sharply off a length, Morgan was in some difficulty but managed to keep the ball down as he paddle-pulled to fine leg
Bollinger to Strauss, no run wide and very short outside off stump, Strauss sways his head out of the way but he needn't have moved. Bollinger lucky not to be called for that one
Bollinger to Strauss, 2 runs angling in to the pads this time and Strauss glances to fine leg's right. As the fielder runs round they push for two
Bollinger to Strauss, no run on the spot, pitching just outside off on a length and angling in. Strauss defends to cover
Bollinger to Strauss, no run speared in at leg stump, this was there to be hit but Strauss couldn't get anything on it and the ball thumps into his pad - was going way down leg so no appeal
Bollinger to Strauss, no run Bollinger pushes Strauss back in the crease to finish, defended to point off the back foot
Harris to Morgan, 1 run short, but the ball didn't get up very high and Morgan pulls out to deep square leg
Harris to Strauss, no run back of length, Strauss aims the punch through cover but inside edges onto his thigh pad. That didn't bounce too far from the stumps as it came down...
Harris to Strauss, FOUR runs hammered. Short, decent pace on the ball but Strauss is just too good on the pull and crunches this authoritatively out to the deep midwicket boundary
Harris to Strauss, no run chopped to point
Harris to Strauss, 1 run leg-stump half volley and Strauss clips easily out to square leg
Harris to Morgan, no run well left by Morgan, as Harris slants one across him
Bollinger to Strauss, no run pitching on a length just outside off, and moving away off the seam a touch. Strauss drops the ball defensively towards point

Bollinger to Strauss, FOUR runs short and rearing up to Strauss's grille, but he's in good touch and hooks the ball infront of his face and out to long leg. Great shot, he was in a good position and got a solid connection
Bollinger to Strauss, no run short again, but wide of off this time and Strauss ducks out of the way this time
Bollinger to Strauss, no run more back of a length stuff, Strauss hops onto the back foot and taps the ball back towards the bowler
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run Bollinger fires this one in very full as Strauss shuffles right across to off and clips down to fine leg. It would've been interesting if he'd missed that...
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run short outside off, angled down to third man
Hopes to Morgan, no run tight start, on a length and outside off, angling in and tapped back to the bowler

Hopes to Morgan, SIX runs what a hit! Where did that come from? Morgan just wondered down the wicket, catching the ball on the half-volley and lifting it easily back over Hopes's head and several rows back into the crowd at long-off.
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run nudged down to third man
Hopes to Strauss, 2 runs nicely played, off the face of the bat and intentionally placed very fine towards third man, who runs round but can't negate the second run
Hopes to Strauss, 1 run again angled down to third man, easy runs
Hopes to Morgan, no run straighter this time, and Morgan pushes the ball firmly towards point
Tait to Strauss, 1 run back of a length just outside off, feisty delivery but it's chopped down just past the diving backward point fielder for one

Tait to Morgan, 2 runs Morgan didn't know too much about that one, but they've picked up two! He was aiming to push a length ball into the covers but the ball squirted off the inside edge to midwicket. Acres of space out there, and sharp running brings a second r
Tait to Morgan, no run Tait keeps Morgan on the back foot, as he defends into the off side
Tait to Morgan, 1 run slower one, but he's picked it and drops the ball to cover for a sharp single. Good call, Strauss called him through straight away
Tait to Strauss, 1 run more tip-and-run from England, as Strauss this time pushes the ball into the gap at cover
Tait to Morgan, no run shorter this time, Morgan taps to cover off the back foot, the ball going too quickly to the fielder for any thought of another quick single
Hopes to Strauss, no run tapped to mid off
Hopes to Strauss, no run misses off stump by a whisker! That wasn't too short but Strauss was back into an expansive pull. He was beaten on the under edge and the ball whizzed just past the stumps
Hopes to Strauss, 1 run short-arm jab down to wide long-on
Hopes to Morgan, no run Morgan beaten on the outside edge this time, as he aims to run the ball down to third man but can't get a touch on it
Hopes to Morgan, no run cutter, slightly slower through the air, and Morgan nudges to midwicket

Hopes to Morgan, FOUR runs cheeky, cheeky innovation from Morgan! He's having fun out there, as he shuffles right across to off and sets himself for the Dilscoop, getting the ball away to the fine leg boundary but he tumbled over in the process!
Tait to Strauss, (no ball) ooh, that could've been nasty! This one slips out of the hand and ends up a beamer, but way outside off. Tait raises his hand in apology
Tait to Strauss, 1 run on a length outside off, pushed out to deep cover
Tait to Morgan, no run bouncer, Morgan ducks quickly underneath it as the ball leaps over the leg stump line
Tait to Morgan, no run bounce and carry from Tait! That wasn't too short at all, but just leapt up off a length to beat the bat by a good few inches. Paine takes it over his head
Tait to Morgan, no run much fuller this time, Morgan is rushed somewhat in the drive, and the ball rolls to cover

Tait to Morgan, no run beaten for pace on the pull this time. Again, it wasn't too short but it got up to chest height. Morgan went for the pull but the ball was on to him too quickly and squirted off the toe of the bat to the off side
Tait to Morgan, 1 wide flung well wide of off stump, that's a big wide
Tait to Morgan, 1 run sharp finish, again back of a length and Morgan hops as he nudges to midwicket
Smith to Morgan, no run full and driven to mid-off
Smith to Morgan, 1 run paddle-swept nicely down to fine leg. He was thinking about the reverse-sweep there, but changed his mind when he picked up the line
Smith to Strauss, 1 run pushed out to point and they take a quick single
Smith to Morgan, no run there's some turn for Smith as he pitches one in the rough outside off, but Morgan is well forward to smother it
Smith to Morgan, 1 run sharp turn again! But this one is just too short, and with the field spread Morgan is in no trouble pushing the ball in the air out to midwicket
Smith to Strauss, 1 run couple of steps down the track, and nudged to the on side
Harris to Strauss, 1 run round the wicket and driven square off the back foot to deep point...brings up the fifty stand
Harris to Morgan, 1 run runs this down to third man...Morgan again in full control
Harris to Strauss, 1 run worked off the stumps to the left of midwicket
Harris to Morgan, no run misses a flick to the leg side and is taken on the pad
Harris to Morgan, no run driven on the up square to point
Harris to Morgan, FOUR runs that's an effortless drive from Morgan, was very full outside off and he placed it perfectly through the covers with timing to beat the sweeper
Smith to Strauss, no run down the pitch and worked out to midwicket
Smith to Strauss, no run spins in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
Smith to Strauss, 1 leg bye brings out a reverse hack, not really Strauss's shot and it dribbles to short third-man
Smith to Yardy, 1 run onto the front foot, pushed square on the off side
Smith to Strauss, 1 run uses his feet and clips it nicely down the ground
Harris to Strauss, 1 run goes for the pull, doesn't time it out to deep square
Harris to Yardy, no run finds the outside edge but virtually rolls along the ground to the keeper
Harris to Yardy, no run worked from off stump down to mid on
Harris to Yardy, 1 run opens the face and collects a single to third man...this a chance for Yardy to get a nice not out
Harris to Wright, no run forced off the back foot to point
Smith to Yardy, 1 run worked from outside off with the spin down to long on
Smith to Wright, no run flicked straight to midwicket
Smith to Yardy, FOUR runs comes a long way across his crease, exposes all the stumps but gets a little tickle down to fine leg
Smith to Yardy, no run pushed back to the bowler
Smith to Yardy, no run worked with the spin out to midwicket
Tait to Bresnan, 1 run wow, almost strikes with a fearsome short ball that leaps at Bresnan, takes the shoulder of the bat but falls just out of reach of a diving backward point
Tait to Yardy, 1 run wide full toss outside and driven out to the cover sweeper
Tait to Bresnan, no run goes full this time, swinging in towards middle stump but met with a full face to mid on
Tait to Bresnan, 1 run another full, swinging yorker which he digs out right by his feet and they scamper a well-judged single
Tait to Swann, 1 bye play and miss outside off, a full ball swings past Swann's drive and Paine can't gather cleaning...Swann only realises late on there's a bye to be taken
Bollinger to Swann, (no ball) 1 run full outside off, driven square down to third man...and Ponting had too many men outside the circle so it's a no-ball, too, but no free hit
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run driven straight cover
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run full and searching for swing, driven down to mid off
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run that's a beauty, pitches outside off and beats Bresnan's nervous poke through to the keeper...a cracking delivery
Bollinger to Bresnan, 1 run width outside off and driven hard down to third man
Bollinger to Swann, 1 leg bye huge appeal for lbw! Bollinger was convinced but I think Swann got his foot outside off stump when he was struck on the boot
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run flicked from middle stump down to mid on
Tait to Swann, no run down the leg side, Swann goes for a pull but doesn't make contact but it's not called wide
Tait to Swann, no run late swing that beats Swann's drive again and the pace is still up there...danger time for Swann here who likes to play his shots
Tait to Swann, no run targets another yorker and comes out a low full toss which is bunted straight to mid on
Tait to Swann, no run another huge appeal from Australia, this time as Swann ducks under a bouncer but the umpire says it came off the arm guard
Tait to Swann, no run full into the pads and into the leg side
Tait to Swann, 1 leg bye on a length, takes the thigh pad into square leg and Swann keeps the strike
Bollinger to Broad, no run play and miss first ball! Goes for a drive but it was a half-hearted effort...well bowled
Bollinger to Broad, no run goes for another flamboyant drive...there is no need for that and is so lucky not to get an outside edge
Bollinger to Broad, no run goes for the full, swinging yorker and it's turned out to midwicket
Bollinger to Broad, no run that's a cracker on off stump that lifts past Broad's outside edge...he doesn't look in any sort of form
Harris to Bresnan, 2 runs full on the stumps and heaved away through the leg side to huge cheers from the crowd
Harris to Bresnan, no run full outside off and driven one handed into the covers...can't get any there
Harris to Bresnan, no run low full toss which is slammed straight back to Harris...looks like Bresnan feels he has to do this himself
Harris to Bresnan, no run brilliant stuff from Harris, full on off stump and Bresnan can only jab to cover
Harris to Bresnan, FOUR runs boundary...what a time for it as Bresnan gives himself a touch of room and launches this high over extra cover with enough force to find the rope
Harris to Bresnan, 1 run and now Bresnan keeps the strike as he drives a single to mid off on the edge of the ring

Hopes to Bresnan, FOUR runs he's done it...leans back and scythes an edge through the vacant third man area, past the man inside the circle. England celebrate as they secure the series but, boy, they made it tough

England 3 Australia 0. It's not a football score (England would never score that many) and it means the series is in the bag for Andrew Strauss which, despite today's major wobble, is a notable achievement for this evolving one-day side. Credit to Australia, they gave i

"The dressing room is buzzing and it's a great place to be although it wasn't 20 minutes ago!"
